In *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, **Loki** is the [chaotic](/wiki/Chaotic "Chaotic") [god](/wiki/God "God") of the [Valkyrie](/wiki/Valkyrie "Valkyrie") pantheon.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Origin](#Origin)
- [2 Variants](#Variants)
  - [2.1 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
- [3 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Loki](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Special:Search/Loki "wikipedia:Special:Search/Loki")***

Loki is a deity in Norse mythology: he is the son of the [jötunn](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J%C3%B6tunn "wikipedia:Jötunn") Fárbauti and Laufey (mentioned as a goddess), and the brother of Helblindi and Býleistr. Loki is married to Sigyn, with who he has two sons, Narfi (or Nari) and Váli; he is the father of Hel, the wolf Fenrir, and the world serpent Jörmungandr by the jötunn Angrboða. In the form of a mare, Loki was impregnated by the stallion Svaðilfari and gave birth to the eight-legged horse Sleipnir, the steed of [Odin](/wiki/Odin "Odin"). Loki is a trickster god and shape shifter - he sometimes assists the other gods, and other times he behaves maliciously towards them. Loki's positive relations towards the gods are ended when he engineers the death of the god Baldr.

Baldr and his mother Frigg had a prophetic dream of his death, and Frigg made every object on earth vow never to hurt Baldr, except for the mistletoe (which was either too young to make a legal vow, or else considered too unimportant to ask). Loki hears of this, and during a gathering where the gods hurled objects at the otherwise-invulnerable Baldr, he tricks Baldr's brother Höðr into shooting a mistletoe arrow at him; after the arrow slays the otherwise-invulnerable Baldr, Loki is bound as punishment. The goddess Skaði (or Skadi) places a venom-dripping serpent above the bound Loki, and Sigyn uses a bowl to collect the venom, but must empty it once it becomes full; in the meantime, the venom that drips onto Loki caused him to writhe in pain, which is explained as the source of earthquakes. With the onset of Ragnarök, Loki is foretold to slip free from his bonds and join the jötnar in fighting against the gods - Heimdallr, the watchman of the gods, and Loki are fated to slay each other.

## Variants

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack") and [notnotdNetHack](/wiki/NotnotdNetHack "NotnotdNetHack"), Loki is a chaotic god of unholiness, and his [minions](/wiki/Minion "Minion") consist of [hell hound pups](/wiki/Hell_hound_pup "Hell hound pup"), adult [hell hounds](/wiki/Hell_hound "Hell hound"), [fire giants](/wiki/Fire_giant "Fire giant"), and [Brighid Eladrin](/index.php?title=Brighid_Eladrin\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Brighid Eladrin (page does not exist)"). He does not have a [crowning](/wiki/Crowning "Crowning") gift of his own, but will give a crowned Valkyrie [The Bow of Skadi](/index.php?title=The_Bow_of_Skadi\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "The Bow of Skadi (page does not exist)").

## Encyclopedia entry

Loki, or Lopt, is described in Snorri's \_Edda\_ as being  
"pleasing and handsome in appearance, evil in character, and  
very capricious in behaviour". He is the son of the giant  
Farbauti and of Laufey.  
Loki is the Norse god of cunning, evil, thieves, and fire.  
He hated the other gods and wanted to ruin them and overthrow  
the universe. He committed many murders. As a thief, he  
stole Freyja's necklace, Thor's belt and gauntlets of power,  
and the apples of youth. Able to shapechange at will, he is  
said to have impersonated at various times a mare, flea, fly,  
falcon, seal, and an old crone. As a mare he gave birth to  
Odin's horse Sleipnir. He also allegedly sired the serpent  
Midgard, the mistress of the netherworld, Hel, and the wolf  
Fenrir, who will devour the sun at Ragnarok.
